name: Wormhole Daemons of Change
background:
The Wormhole Daemons are monstrous servants of the Havoc Gods who emerge from a different dimension throughout the galaxy. Their forms vary greatly, depending on which god they serve.

Wormhole Daemons are cast offs of dying gods who desperately hope to buy more time for themselves. These Daemons emerge suddenly from wormholes throughout the galaxy, to serve the eldritch will of their gods, only to disappear just as quickly once they have achieved their ends. Their gods are ready to leave nothing but havoc in their wake, just in hopes of extending their own lives for a little longer.
backgroundFull:
For aeons, powerful beings resided in a place beyond space, between the wormholes. Pure psychic entities, they lacked physical form and lived without fear of pain or death. Little can be said for certain about these beings or their origins, as their existence predates the records of even the oldest known civilizations in the galaxy. They observed passively, watching the galaxy progress, but rarely interacted with the species that lived within.

This changed suddenly, when one of their species died. Many have speculated about the cause of this death, but so far the matter remains a mystery. This was the first time one of their kind had experienced death, and others reacted first with curiosity, followed by horror. The horror only grew worse as death began to spread. The deaths started to mount and the rest began to recognize the signs of entropy and decay in themselves.

Each entity would react in their own way, but most would eventually succumb with few exceptions. The being now known as Lust sought to cut away at itself, slicing any signs of imperfection and weakness. Another known as Change, sought to accumulate knowledge more quickly than it could decay. Plague found salvation in physical form, using its power to spread itself and re-assimilate any that it infected. Finally, War learned to draw strength from those it slew.

Soon, these beings turned their attention outwards, hoping that the material world might allow them to stall their demise for a time longer. Anguished to survive, they sought out followers from the lost and desperate and offered them power in exchange for their service and worship. Those who rejected these gods came to know them as Havoc Gods due to the zealotry of their followers and the unrest that they caused.

These Gods are able to manifest their will in the physical world through aspects, fragments of their power and minds, which most refer to as their Daemons. Once manifested, these aspects are mortal, and vulnerable to death and harm, needing food to survive, and which can even adapt and change with experience. Gods must sacrifice a portion of their power to create Daemons, with greater Daemons requiring more of their essence to be contributed. As such, each Havoc God can only manifest so many Daemons at once, and must lose a portion of their power to do so, claiming it back when a Daemon dies.

When they are not carrying out the will of their gods, the Daemons often dwell within a strange space between Wormholes. Their control over these wormholes allows them to appear and disappear within physical space rapidly, allowing them to carry out their Godâ€™s will without fear of reprisal.

How will you serve the will of your god?

specialRules.name: Sergeant
specialRules.description: When this model attacks, unmodified results of 6 to hit deal 1 extra hit (only the original hit counts as a 6 for special rules).

specialRules.name: Unique
specialRules.description: This unit may only be taken once per army.

specialRules.name: Slash
specialRules.description: Ignores Cover, and on unmodified results of 6 to hit, this weapon deals 1 extra hits (only the original hit counts as a 6 for special rules).

specialRules.name: Spell Accumulator
specialRules.description: Gets X accumulator tokens at the start of each round, but canâ€™t hold more than 6 tokens at once. Casters from other friendly units within 12" may spend this model's accumulator tokens as if they were their own spell tokens.

specialRules.name: Shred
specialRules.description: On unmodified results of 1 to block hits, this weapon deals 1 extra wound.

specialRules.name: Ambush Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Ambush. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Unstoppable in Melee Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Unstoppable in melee. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Teleport Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Teleport. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Resistance Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Resistance. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Fearless Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Fearless. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Protected Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Protected. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Changebound
specialRules.description: When units where all models have this rule are shot or charged from over 9" away, enemy units get -1 to hit rolls.

specialRules.name: Changebound Boost Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Changebound Boost. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Split
specialRules.description: When this unit is fully destroyed, you may place a new unit of X fully within 6" of it before removing the last model.

specialRules.name: Ignores Regeneration
specialRules.description: This weapon ignores Regeneration.

specialRules.name: Indirect when Shooting Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Indirect when shooting. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Bounding Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Bounding. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Casting Debuff
specialRules.description: Once per activation, before attacking, pick up to 4 enemy units within 18" with Caster, which gets -1 to casting rolls once (next time the effect would apply).

specialRules.name: Ignores Cover
specialRules.description: This weapon ignores cover.

specialRules.name: Caster
specialRules.description: Gets X spell tokens at the start of each round, but canâ€™t hold more than 6 tokens at once. At any point before attacking, spend as many tokens as the spellâ€™s value to try casting one or more spells (only one try per spell). Roll one die, on 4+ resolve the effect on a target in line of sight. Models within 18â€ in line of sight of the casterâ€™s unit may spend any number of spell tokens at the same time before rolling, to give the caster +1/-1 to the roll per token.

specialRules.name: Ambush
specialRules.description: May be set aside before deployment. At the start of any round after the first, may be deployed anywhere over 9â€ away from enemy units. Players alternate in placing Ambush units, starting with the player that activates next. Units that deploy via Ambush canâ€™t seize or contest objectives on the round they deploy.

specialRules.name: Unstoppable
specialRules.description: Ignores Regeneration, and ignores all negative modifiers to this weapon.

specialRules.name: Teleport
specialRules.description: Once per activation, before attacking, place this model anywhere fully within 6" of its position.

specialRules.name: Resistance
specialRules.description: When a unit where all models have this rule takes wounds, roll one die for each. On a 6+ it is ignored. If the wounds were from a spell, then they are ignored on a 2+ instead.

specialRules.name: Fearless
specialRules.description: When a unit where all models have this rule fails a morale test, roll one die. On a 4+ it counts as passed instead.

specialRules.name: Fear
specialRules.description: This model counts as having dealt +X wounds when checking wound effects in melee (must deal at least one wound).

specialRules.name: Protected
specialRules.description: When a unit where all models have this rule takes wounds, roll one die for each. On a 6+ it is ignored.

specialRules.name: Changebound Boost
specialRules.description: If all models in this unit have Changebound, enemies attacking them always get -1 to hit rolls from Changebound (instead of only when being shot/charged from over 9" away).

specialRules.name: Regeneration
specialRules.description: When a unit where all models have this rule takes wounds, roll one die for each. On a 5+ it is ignored.

specialRules.name: Indirect
specialRules.description: Gets -1 to hit rolls when shooting after moving. May target enemies that are not in line of sight as if in line of sight, and ignores cover from sight obstructions.

specialRules.name: Bounding
specialRules.description: When this unit is activated, you may place all models with this rule in it anywhere fully within D3+1" of their position.

specialRules.name: Bane when Shooting
specialRules.description: This model gets Bane when shooting.

specialRules.name: AP
specialRules.description: Targets get -X to Defense rolls when blocking hits.
